definition: earthquake (old term)
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
the earth quaked, the mountains shook (idiom); a tremendous battle
the world's first seismograph invented by Zhang Heng 张衡 in 132/abbr. for 候風地動儀|候风地动仪
the world's first seismograph invented by Zhang Heng 张衡 in 132

sentences.english: A girl passed close to him, and Lieutenant Blandford started.
sentences.chinese: 一个女孩靠近他走过，布兰佛德中尉吃惊地动了一下。

sentences.english: Was it in 132 AD, when the Chinese scientist Zhang Hêng invented the seismocope?
sentences.chinese: 是公元132年中国科学家张衡发明地动仪的时候吗？

sentences.english: China's Zhang Heng invented the seismograph during the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 中国的张衡在汉朝时发明了地动仪。

sentences.english: The name of a seismograph invented by the ancient Chinese scientist, Zhang Heng.
sentences.chinese: 中国的张衡在汉朝时发明了地动仪。

sentences.english: Bvoid roads, bridges, or ramps that might have been damaged by the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 制止门路，桥梁，或者有可能已经被地动损坏的斜道。

sentences.english: It was made of fine copper, and looked like a big cup with a lid.
sentences.chinese: 地动仪由纯铜制成，看起来像个带盖的大杯子。

sentences.english: With the booming sound which shakes the earth.
sentences.chinese: 随着地动山摇的一声巨响。

sentences.english: The earth shook, the walls rocked, and it troubled us in our sleep.
sentences.chinese: 墙摇地动，我们在睡眠里受了惊扰。

sentences.english: In order to arriver to here before dark, we stared early.
sentences.chinese: 为了在天黑前到达，我们早早地动了身。

sentences.english: The inventor was Zhang Heng, a famous scientist in the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220 AD).
sentences.chinese: 这架地动仪的发明者是中国东汉时著名的科学家张衡。

sentences.english: It landed and a huge explosion shook the earth.
sentences.chinese: 导弹降落了，巨大的爆炸声震得山摇地动。

sentences.english: This will help us move faster.
sentences.chinese: 这将帮助我们更快地动起来。

sentences.english: One day in 138 AD, the dragon in the west expelled its ball.
sentences.chinese: 公元138年的一天，地动仪西边的龙嘴吐出了铜球。

sentences.english: He leads an army so massive it shakes the ground with its march.
sentences.chinese: 他率领的部队是如此豪壮，所到之处地动山摇。

definition: to tremble
to shudder/to shiver/to shake/to tremble
to stir/to lift/to set sth in motion
to rock/to shake/to sway
to move/to shift
to tremble
to sway/to rock
to shake/to sway
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
to tremble/to quiver
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
